attributes.comment:
In responce to rasing the fees for I-600 applications, I would appreciate it if the fees
did not increase, especially for the renewal of our fingerprints since our documents
expire so soon. We are trying to adopt from China and the wait time is 17-18 months
which means we will have to renew our application and cost us even more. The
adoption process is financially draining and more expenses are just not needed. If the
fees were going to increase than I would suggest increasing the time that the
application is good for to 18-24 months so that adoptees would not have to refile. This
would decrease the work load of the USCIS officers and the hassel to the parents to
renew the application. I also understand that the same company that took our
fingerprints for our homestudy agency is the same one that processes our fingerprints
for USCIS. Therefore they already have our records so you could consolidate the
fingerprinting process into one time and save time and money for both the parents and
USCIS.

Thanks for listening! Alissa Kaser

Comment on FR Doc # E7-01631
attributes.title: Comment Submitted by Alissa A. Kaser
